current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To direct the Administrator of the Environmental Protection Agency to publish a health advisory and
			 submit reports with respect to microcystins in drinking water.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Environment and Public Works

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Safe and Secure Drinking Water Protection Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Safe and Secure Drinking Water Protection Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: (referred to in this Act as the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Administrator of the
			 Environmental Protection Agency

quote.#tail: ) shall develop and publish a health advisory including recommendations on—

text.#text: Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, the

the level of microcystins in drinking water below which the water is expected to be safe for human
			 consumption; and
feasible treatment techniques and other means for achieving that level; and
standardized procedures for testing for microcystins in drinking water.
Not later than 180 days after the date of enactment of this Act, and each year thereafter, the
a description of the status of the efforts of the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
to promote testing of drinking water for
			 microcystins in areas
			 that have been affected by harmful algal blooms; and

text.#text: a description of the steps taken by the

an analysis of available treatment techniques and other means for addressing microcystins in
			 drinking water.
